channel.title: Linux Reader
channel.description: I’m David, I spin poi, read books, tinker, and write. Check out what I am doing Now! I started keeping summaries, notes, and reviews of books that I am reading. Let’s Chat! I reply to every email. Here are the current areas of content you can find here: Linux Stuff Tools Networking Writing <— You can also click the links in the side bar.

item.title: Linux
item.description: Fedora My Fedora Setup Silverblue RHCSA Advanced File Management Advanced Package Management Advanced User Management Bash Basic File Managment Basic Package Management Basic User Management Boot Process, Grub2, and Kernel Installation Interaction Local File Systems and Swap Network File System (NFS) Process and Task Scheduling RHCSA Exam Environment Guide RHCSA Notes RHCSA Study Tracker RHCSA Vagrant Lab Setup Sample Exams Security Enhanced Linux Shell Scripting Storage Management System Initialization, Message Logging, and System Tuning The Linux Firewall The Secure Shell Service You Need to Learn Man Pages RHCSA Stuff RHCSA Notes RHCSA Study Tracker Redhat Exam Environment How to Study for RHCSA RHCSA Study Points RHCSA Vagrant Lab Setup Fedora My Fedora SetupMy Fedora Setup Silverblue Misc Using Man Pages wsl2 Bare Metal to Proxmox VM Labs Turn a file into a block device

item.title: Networking
item.description: CCNA Cisco to Juniper Cheat Sheet How to Study for the CCNA Exam My CCNA Notes Resources for Passing CCNA What to Learn After CCNA Juniper consoling_in_to_mx80_from_linux Juniper CLI Basics Junos Fundementals Paste Config on a Juniper Switch Toggle PoE on a Juniper Switch DNS and Time Synchronization How to Study for the CCNA Exam Networking Network Devices and Network Connections Resources for Passing CCNA What to Learn After CCNA The formatting and images of all of my networking notes go destroyed when migrating away from OneNote. But they still come in handy all of the time.

item.title: About
item.description: Hey, I’m David. I am a tech enthusiast interested in Linux, open source projects, Networking, scripting, programming, and cybersecurity. This is my hub where I will be teaching as I learn. This will help me pick up skills better and hopefully help others along the way.
